nodes.description: Kenya's Paradise Hotel was blown up in a suicide attack.
nodes.support_text: Kenya's Paradise Hotel, which was blown up last week, complain that they have not been paid.

nodes.description: Nine staff members of the hotel were killed in the attack.
nodes.support_text: Nine of their colleagues were killed in the suicide attack on the Israeli-owned hotel near the coastal resort of Mombasa.

nodes.description: Former staff of the hotel complain that they have not been paid.
nodes.support_text: Former staff at Kenya's Paradise Hotel, which was blown up last week, complain that they have not been paid.

nodes.description: The hotel was completely destroyed, leaving the staff jobless.
nodes.support_text: The hotel was completely destroyed by the attack, leaving the staff jobless.

nodes.description: The Israeli manager Yehuda Sulami said the hotel might not be rebuilt due to lack of insurance coverage for 'terrorist' attacks.
nodes.support_text: Israeli manager Yehuda Sulami said he was not sure if the hotel would be rebuilt because 'terrorist' attacks were not covered in the insurance policy.

nodes.description: Staff booed the manager during a demonstration and accused him of repeatedly promising payment without fulfilling it.
nodes.support_text: We depended on tips from the guests which was not enough Josephine Mbuli Hairdresser The hotel was completely destroyed by the attack, leaving the staff jobless. Israeli manager Yehuda Sulami said he was not sure if the hotel would be rebuilt because 'terrorist' attacks were not covered in the insurance policy. He tried to calm tempers during a demonstration and promised they would be paid soon. : Mombasa voices Kenyans react to terror attacks Reuters news agency reports that staff booed him as he spoke.

nodes.description: The manager promised that salaries would be paid soon and that medical treatment for staff would be covered.
nodes.support_text: He tried to calm tempers during a demonstration and promised they would be paid soon.

nodes.description: Thirteen people were arrested in connection with the attacks, which US President George Bush has blamed on al-Qaeda.
nodes.support_text: Thirteen people have been arrested in connection with the attacks, which US President George Bush has blamed on the al-Qaeda network.

nodes.description: A British passenger plane narrowly missed missiles as it took off from Mombasa airport shortly after the hotel attack.
nodes.support_text: A British passenger plane narrowly missed missiles as it took off from Mombasa airport shortly after the hotel attack.

nodes.description: The British High Commission in Nairobi evacuated its staff after receiving a specific threat that was being treated seriously.
nodes.support_text: The British High Commission in Nairobi has evacuated its staff from its building in Nairobi after a threat was received.

nodes.description: Josephine Mbuli, a hairdresser, worked for three years to support her eight siblings and mother with tips from guests, which was not enough.
nodes.support_text: Josephine Mbuli, 23, who worked as a hairdresser for three years to support her eight siblings and mother, said, 'We depended on tips from the guests which was not enough.'

nodes.description: 苏拉米告诉记者，十一月的工资没有支付，九月的一些工资也需要支付，但他保证工资会尽快支付。
nodes.support_text: Promises 'There's no question that November salaries have not been paid,' Mr Sulami told reporters. 'Some we also have to pay for September. But there's no question their salaries will be paid as soon as possible.'

nodes.description: 苏拉米说酒店管理层正在支付员工的医疗费用，甚至将一些人送往以色列的医院，那些遇难者的家人也会得到帮助。
nodes.support_text: He said that the hotel management was paying for the medical treatment for staff and had even taken some to hospitals in Israel. The families of those killed would be helped, Mr Sulami said.

nodes.description: 员工对老板的承诺感到失望，认为他们生活在希望中。
nodes.support_text: 她说他们非常耐心，希望随时能收到工资，老板不断承诺，他们一直生活在希望中。

nodes.description: BBC的格雷·普姆贝亚说，天堂酒店是莫桑比克地区唯一的以色列酒店。
nodes.support_text: The BBC's Gray Phombeah says that Paradise Hotel was the only Israeli-owned hotel in the Mombasa area.

Israeli manager Yehuda Sulami said he was not sure if the hotel would be rebuilt because 'terrorist' attacks were not covered in the insurance policy.

He tried to calm tempers during a demonstration and promised they would be paid soon.
